Portal ist spielmechanisch gut umgesetzt. Die Rätsel sind sehr einfach zu durchschauen und erst im letzten viertel des Spieles wirklich anspruchsvoll und auch erst hier gibt es interessante Anekdoten.

Bis auf die kurze Spielzeit überzeugt dieses Spiel und sollte bevorzugt in einem Bundle (Orange Box) bezogen werden. Portal kann man alleine spielen, aber vieles wirkt interessanter, wenn es als schöne Abwechslung zu Half-Life gespielt wird.

Este juego es una delicia. Ya tiene tiempo, pero sigue siendo una lección para cualquier juego de puzzles. Se pueden hacer juegos de puzzles de forma inteligente sin fichitas ni caramelitos. Además la historia es fascinante y te sorprende a cada paso que avanzas. Es corto, pero muy intenso. Imprescindible.

A game that was really unique when it came out. It's funny, fun and a great mix of jump and run, puzzle solving and great story telling. Even today it is still a game that many people love to play. The only downside is that the game is really short. I would still recommend it to anyone who likes puzzle games and is not new to first person controls in video games.

One of the most original games ever. The music is legendary.

Это скорее не рекомендация, а признание в любви. Эта одна из немногих игр, которая получает от меня оценку "ШИКАРНО!". Я обожаю в этой игре практически всё! Обожаю её светлые комнаты, прекрасный геймплей, идеальный, по-моему, уровень сложности: не так сложно, чтобы мучиться в поиске решения задачи, и в то же время очень интересно (хотя, каждому своё - мой отец и моя девушка (конечно же я рекомендовал эту игру своим родным, практически заставлял их в неё играть) иногда умудрялись кое-где застревать) - а для тех, кому показалась, что основная кампания слишком простая, в игре присутствуют специальные уровни с повышенной сложностью. Обожаю атмосферу этой игры, GLaDOS и её речи (и её финальную песенку, конечно же), турельки, тайники и надписи оставленные кровью... Куб-компаньон в моем сердце навеки! ОБОЖАЮ ТОРТИК!!!
Во время игры мы видим на ногах героини странные преспособления, и в игре, на сколько я помню, ни разу не говориться что это вообще такое и зачем, и только из второй части мы узнаём, что эти преспособления нужны, чтобы с высоты безопасно падать... Считаю, что такое внимание к деталям заслуживает отдельного уважения.
PORTAL - я тебя люблю!

P.S. The cake is a lie.
Хочу значок. Но все равно, под "Still Alive" я плакал.

What do you mean you haven't played Portal yet?

Portal 1 might as well be its own genre with how many games tried to replicate its success. And while I think that the second entry to the series is objectively better, the first entry is still a must play and provides a completely different experience than its sequel(or other "portal-esque" games for that matter).

The gameplay is, as you would expect, about portals and solving puzzles with them. As you progress, more and more elements are introduced one after another, making the game progressively more difficult, but it never feels overwhelming. When you get stuck for a long time and eventually figure out what you are supposed to do, it never feels like it was the games fault for not explaining its mechanics well enough or not showing you every important piece at play. There are some bugs here and there, but thats pretty much expected from a 14 year old game and none of them make the game unplayable.

Talking about level design, I would say that the difficulty here is a bit higher than what you would find in Portal 2, but do not expect anything that is too complex. Also in comparison, there is a lot more moments that test your quick thinking making aperture science feel a bit more dangerous, but at times it can also lead to an unfair death. Once you finish the game, you gain access to challenges that either change layouts of some of the levels, or require you to finish the level with a limited amount of time, portals or steps taken. While the latter might not sound as exciting, it really forces you to think outside of the box, often making you come up with completely new solutions to previously solved problems.

Now as for the atmosphere, this is where Portal truly shines. The old Source engine has the tendency to make people feel as if they were being watched by someone even with nobody around and this is the one game where it is narratively true. Going through the desolate yet clean test chambers and then the less clean parts of the facility always manage to make me feel that exact feeling even after dozens of hours of playtime, and I think that that is why this experience is so unforgettable for me and so many other people.

With all of that overly positive stuff said, the story is good and nothing more than that. It does its job but if not for the great writing and storytelling(including, at the time working, ARG website), it would not be that memorable. The graphics are good for its time but not that impressive nowadays, and... the only other "negative" thing that I can think of is that it was too short, ending after about 3-5 hours on the first playthrough.

Overall Portal is still one of the best puzzle games ever made and my bias for it will probably never change. While the sequel is better in a lot of ways both objectively and subjectively, the first game still has a lot to offer and is an absolute must play.

9/10

I bought the Orange Box (in an actual box) long, long ago for HL2. I knew nothing about Portal and installed it one night on a whim. Several hours later, I had completed it in one sitting with a stupid grin on my face. If you somehow have not played or better yet, heard of Portal before (I am jealous of you);  buy it, play it and bask in the glory.

This game is great, super innovative, creative, interesting, and has compelling little secrets scattered across it, its amazing how Valve managed to cram story into this quaint little game, but they did, its a shame not many people have played this game, if you know someone who hasn't, reccomend them to play this fantastic and amazing game, like right now.

A seminal work of game design; while many of the concepts behind this game weren't completely novel when it was first published, it does perhaps the best job I have seen of teaching players an entirely new skill from scratch (in this case, how to use Portals to solve a variety of mind-bending puzzles) without feeling overbearing or (too) confusing.

A relatively short, but challenging puzzle game with some action-y bits, this game, of all Valve's classic collection, has held up best to the test of time.  Highly recommended.
